BETRAYAL.Definition: the act of not showing loyalty

WELFARE.Definition: help given to the citizens by the state

FLAT-PACK FURNITURE.Definition: furniture that is sold in pieces inside a flat box

PILLAGING.Definition: robbery or stealing by using violence

CARVINGS.Definition: designs or patterns cut into wood

POLYTHEISTIC.Definition: that had lots of different gods

RAVENS.Definition: large, black birds, similar to crows

THUNDER.Definition: the loud noise heard after a lightning flash

HAMMER.Definition: a tool or weapon with a heavy metal head at the end of a handle

TRICKERY.Definition: the use of tricks or dishonest ways, deception

MISTLETOE.Definition: a poisonous plant with white berries

VENOMOUS.Definition: able to use a poisonous liquid

CHARIOT.Definition: a vehicle of the past, pulled by animals

ELVES.Definition: imaginary beings, looking like small humans with pointy ears

DWARVES.Definition: imaginary beings, looking like short humans with long beards

RAID.Definition: attack suddenly, usually with a small group of people

GRAVESTONES.Definition: large stones with words written into them, which were placed on the spot where people were buried

TROLLS.Definition: imaginary scary beings in traditional Scandinavian stories

MINING.Definition: the activity of removing substances such as coal or metal from the ground by digging

SUPERNATURAL.Definition: not able to be found in nature, extraordinary

WEREWOLF.Definition: a person who changes for periods of time into a wolf

INITIALS.Definition: the first letters of his first and last name
